item.title: Megabonk: How to Unlock All Items
item.description:
For a stronger build in Megabonk , you’ll need to keep unlocking new and better items. These items not only change how you play but can also completely shift the outcome of a run. At first, your selection is pretty limited, with only a handful of default unlocks showing up.

The good news is that the more you play, the more options you’ll have. Item spawns are random, but you can unlock a lot more items by completing quests and meeting specific milestones. Once an item is unlocked and purchased with Silver, it’ll start appearing in your future runs in Megabonk .

All Items in Megabonk and How To Unlock Them

Currently, there are 78 items in Megabonk . This table breaks down each of them, explaining how to unlock them and what they do for you.

Item

How to Unlock

Effect

Anvil

Complete 3 challenges

Weapon upgrades can now have +2 stats.

Backpack

Unlocked by default

+1 Projectile Count for all Weapons.

Battery

Upgrade the Cooldown Tome to Level 5

+8% Attack Speed.

Beacon

Unlocked by default

Charging a Charge Shrine creates a healing zone and spawns +2 extra Shrines in future stages.

Beefy Ring

Unlocked by default

Adds +20% Damage per 100 Max HP.

Beer

Unlocked by default

Adds +20% Damage at the cost of -5% Max HP.

Big Bonk

Unlocked by default

2% chance to BONK an enemy, dealing 20x damage.

Bloody Cleaver

Reach Level 50 as Vlad

Lifesteal now activates Bloodmark stacks. Also adds 50% chance to apply Bloodmark.

Bob (Dead)

Survive the Final Swarm for 2 minutes

For every 14 units moved, summon Bob (dead).

Borgar

Unlocked by default

Has +2% chance to spawn Borgar on kill, healing you.

Boss Buster

Defeat a Stage Boss in under 30 seconds

Gives +15% more damage to Elites and Bosses.

Brass Knuckles

Kill 5,000 enemies with the Sword

Gives +20% damage to nearby enemies.

Cactus

Kill 100 cactus enemies with Thorns damage

Shoots spikes when taking damage, scales with Thorns.

Campfire

Unlocked by default

Standing still heals you.

Chonkplate

Reach 500 Max HP

Grants +20% Lifesteal and allows overheal up to 75% of Max HP.

Clover

Unlocked by default

Adds +7.5% Luck.

Coward’s Cloak

Unlocked by default

Boosts Move Speed when hit; +5% base Move Speed.

Credit Card (Green)

Unlocked by default

Adds +2% Luck when opening a chest.

Credit Card (Red)

Unlocked by default

Adds +2.5% Damage when opening a chest.

Cursed Doll

Die 10 times

Curse enemies, dealing 30% of their Max HP as damage per second.

Cursed Grabbies

Get the Cursed Tome to Level 10

+10% Difficulty, 0.8x Max HP, 5% chance to cast curse on hit.

Demonic Blade

Heal for 350 HP using Lifesteal

Critical hits have a 25% chance to heal you.

Demonic Blood

Increase your Max HP with Blood Magic 400 times

Gives you +9 Max HP, bonus Armor and Thorns.

Demonic Soul

Reach Level 30 as Calcium

Gives +0.1% Damage per kill (up to 100%).

Dragonfire

Kill 4,000 enemies with fire damage

Has a 15% chance on hit to summon dragonfire that burns enemies.

Eagle Claw

Kill 10,000 enemies as Birdo

66% Damage vs airborne enemies, 8% chance to launch them into the air.

Echo Shard

Upgrade the XP Tome to Level 8

Has +12% chance to spawn a bonus XP Shard on kill.

Electric Plug

Unlocked by default

On taking damage, send out an electric shock.

Energy Core

Defeat a Final Boss 2 times

Gives a cooldown reduction and energy regen.

Feathers

Unlocked by default

Lets you jump higher and further.

Forbidden Juice

Crit 100 times in a run

Gives +10% Crit Chance.

Gamer Goggles

Defeat a Stage Boss with less than 10% HP

Increased damage the lower your HP.

Gas Mask

Kill 5,000 enemies using Amog

Gain Armor and Lifesteal for each poisoned enemy.

Ghost

Survive the Final Swarm for 60 seconds

Summons ghosts using an interactable.

Giant Fork

Unlocked by default

Crits can become Megacrits.

Golden Glove

Unlocked by default

Earn +15% more gold from kills.

Golden Shield

Unlocked by default

Gain gold when taking damage.

Golden Sneakers

Break 150 pots

Earn money by moving.

Grandma’s Secret Tonic

Kill 3,000 enemies with the Sniper Rifle

Crits have a 50% chance to exploding, dealing 50% damage.

Gym Sauce

Unlocked by default

+10% flat Damage.

Holy Book

Kill the first Stage Boss without taking damage

+100 Max HP, +50 HP Regen, healing radiates damaging energy.

Ice Cube

Unlocked by default

20% chance to inflict ice damage; ice can now freeze.

Ice Crystal

Get 50 kills with Frostwalker

7.5% freeze chance; executes enemies at threshold HP.

Idle Juice

Kill 500 enemies while standing still

+100% Damage cap while stationary.

Joe’s Dagger

Kill 10,000 enemies using the Dexecutioner

1% chance to Execute. Each Execute adds +1% Damage.

Kevin

Get 3 Leeching Crystals in one run

25% chance to punch you on hit (cannot kill you).

Key

Purchase 25 chests

10% chance for chests to open for free.

Leeching Crystal

Upgrade the Regen Tome to Level 8

+50% Max HP at the cost of -50% HP Regen.

Lightning Orb

Kill 3,000 enemies with lightning damage

25% chance to summon lightning on hit; can stun.

Medkit

Unlocked by default

+45 HP Regen.

Mirror

Unlocked by default

Reflects all incoming damage and grants brief invulnerability.

Moldy Cheese

Unlocked by default

+40% poison chance on hit.

Moldy Gloves

Use a Microwave to duplicate Moldy Cheese 3x

Creates a moldy poison cloud on hit.

Oats

Unlocked by default

+25 Max HP.

Overpowered Lamp

Unlocked by default

+1 proc chance on hit effects.

Phantom Shroud

Unlocked by default

After evading, next hit deals 2x Damage; boosts Attack Speed & Move Speed briefly.

Power Gloves

Unlocked by default

8% chance to create a giant blast on hit.

Quin’s Mask

Defeat a Stage Boss as Athena with Aegis

Thorns damage has a 50% chance to explode.

Scarf

Unlocked by default

+33% Damage while airborne.

Shattered Knowledge

Upgrade Attraction Tome to Level 8

XP Shards slice through enemies on travel.

Skuleg

Obtain 40% Difficulty

+7% Difficulty.

Slippery Ring

Unlocked by default

+15% Evasion.

Slurp Gloves

Unlocked by default

Cast blood magic on hit; heals 7.5% with AoE burst, 9s cooldown.

Slutty Cannon

Kill 5,000 enemies with Slutty Rocket

20% chance to spawn missiles on kill.

Soul Harvester

Survive the Final Swarm for 6 minutes

Killing an enemy summons 2 homing souls.

Spicy Meatball

Unlocked by default

25% chance for attacks to explode, dealing 65% AoE Damage.

Spiky Shield

Unlocked by default

Gain +2 Thorns per 1% Armor and +10% Armor.

Speed Boi

Complete a stage with 2+ Boss Curses

On less than 50% HP, it can slow time and deal 2x Damage.

Sucky Magnet

Complete every Charge Shrine on a map

Periodically drags in all XP Shards.

Tactical Glasses

Defeat a Miniboss in 25s or less

+20% Damage to enemies above 90% HP.

Thunder Mitts

Unlocked by default

On hit, generate a lightning strike (10s cooldown).

Time Bracelet

Unlocked by default

Gives you +8% XP Gain.

Toxic Barrel

Kill 2,000 enemies with Poison damage

Releases a toxic cloud when hit.

Turbo Skates

Upgrade both Cooldown & Agility Tomes to Level 5 in one run

Move Speed converts to Attack Speed, max +40% per stack.

Turbo Socks

Upgrade the Agility Tome to Level 5

Increases +15% Move Speed.

Unstable Transfusion

Unlocked by default

Has a +27% chance to apply Bloodmark on hit.

Wrench

Unlocked by default

Shrines charge 4 seconds faster and give +7.5% shrine rewards.

Za Warudo

Unlocked by default

On fatal damage, you can freeze time (one use).

9.0 /10

Megabonk

item.title: Fortnite Leak Reveals More Upcoming Kpop Demon Hunters Cosmetics
item.description:
A popular Fortnite leaker has revealed that Epic Games may be adding more cosmetics based on the hit Netflix movie Kpop Demon Hunters at some point in the near future, which could include an emote for the highly requested song "Golden." Fortnite is currently in the middle of Chapter 6 Season 5 and will soon be launching its annual Fortnitemares event.

Epic Games recently released a major collaboration between Fortnite and Kpop Demon Hunters , giving players the opportunity to purchase skins of the characters Rumi, Mira, and Zoey. The crossover also included a wide variety of accessories, such as unique back blings and stylish pickaxes. In addition to cosmetics, players can participate in the new Demon Rush mode, which puts a Kpop Demon Hunters twist on the title's classic Horde Rush mode. Special items have even made their way into Fortnite 's battle royale modes, like a shield bubble that plays "Golden" while players are inside of it.

"Golden" and "How It’s Done" May Be Coming to Fortnite

In a recent post on Twitter, the prominent leaker ShiinaBR revealed that even more Kpop Demon Hunters cosmetics could be coming to the popular battle royale. While some fans have been clamoring to get their hands on additional costumes for Rumi, Mira, and Zoey, it seems as if this next wave of cosmetics could be focused on music. According to ShiinaBR, players will soon be able to purchase emotes for the songs "Golden" and "How It's Done." The collaboration may also include a microphone for Rumi and a free loading screen that can be earned as a part of upcoming quest rewards.

While many fans in the comments seemed to be excited about the addition of more cosmetics, some people claimed that the collaboration is missing a key component: Jam Tracks. Fortnite 's Jam Tracks have become a big part of the game. While they are primarily used in the Fortnite Festival mode, Jam Tracks can also be slotted into the "Moments" section of one's locker. When players utilize this feature, they can choose a song that will play as they drop from the battle bus or when they win a match. Since the soundtrack of Kpop Demon Hunters has proven to be a big hit in its own right, it makes sense that players would like to see its biggest songs come to the battle royale.

In addition to Kpop Demon Hunters , it seems as if Epic Games could be releasing a major collaboration between Fortnite and Tron: Ares . While the crossover hasn't been officially announced, leakers have claimed that the rumored cosmetics will arrive in the Item Shop on October 7. With so much content to enjoy and even more crossovers just around the corner, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Fortnite .

295
8.9 /10

Fortnite

item.title: The Best-Selling Games Developed By Ubisoft (& How Much They Sold)
item.description:
Ubisoft is one of the leading video game companies, acting both as a developer and publisher, with subsidiaries across the world and many well-known games and multi-million-selling franchises such as Assassin's Creed , Prince of Persia , Rayman , and Far Cry.

The company was founded in 1986 in northwest France as a small sales business, but eventually branched into the video games industry with its first game, Trivial Pursuit . Their second game, Zombi , was a critical and commercial success. Later, with the publishing of Rayman , the studio was put on the world map. Ubisoft games usually perform well financially, making massive profits for the company. What's most notable about Ubisoft-developed games today is that every triple-A project can involve contributions from as many as ten different studios, with thousands of developers working across the globe.

Updated October 6, 2025, by Vlad Mazanko: Regardless of a player's personal feelings toward the company, there's no denying that Ubisoft is a major force in the video game industry, with several franchises surpassing a total of 50 million sales. While some recent Ubisoft games have fallen short of expectations, including Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora and Star Wars Outlaws, several others, like Assassin's Creed Shadows , have already established themselves as one of the best-selling releases of the year.

Ubisoft is among many gaming companies that rarely reveal exact sales figures for its titles, especially in recent years. Instead, the company often focuses on other metrics, such as player engagement, total player counts (including Ubisoft+ subscribers), or profit generated over time, which often includes in-game purchases and microtransactions. This means that not every sales figure for its most popular titles is officially confirmed, leaving room for projections, comparisons, and analytics regarding its games' performance.

This list has been updated to provide the most accurate sales numbers possible based on both official data and independent analytics for Ubisoft's best-selling titles. Note that the figures listed below may not be strictly official or 100% precise , but they represent a fairly reliable ranking of the company's top sellers as of 2025.

25 Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

Estimated Sales: 6 to 7 Million Units

Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
9.2 /10
Released
October 28, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Blood, Suggestive Themes, Violence
8 Images
Powered by

The Assassin's Creed series, one of Ubisoft's flagship franchises, probably would've never been made if the Prince of Persia trilogy hadn't existed. The first game in the series, The Sands of Time , was an incredible title that wowed players upon its arrival.

The smooth nature of the game's platforming, coupled with its great combat, made this game an absolute masterpiece that fans still love to this day. Later games in the series might've made more questionable design choices, but The Sands of Time still stands strong as one of the greatest action platformers ever made.

24 Just Dance 4

Estimated Sales: Around 8 Million Units

Just Dance 4
7 /10
Released
October 2, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

The Just Dance series peaked during 2010–2011, boosted by the Wii's casual gaming popularity. While Just Dance 4's sales had already dropped notably compared to earlier entries, it still turned out to be a massively profitable annual release for Ubisoft, with over 4 million units sold in the US alone during the first few months, and total sales confirmed to have exceeded 7 million units worldwide in the game's first year.

While Ubisoft continued to release annual Just Dance games that remained popular, there was an undeniable drop in sales numbers with each passing year. As a result, no Just Dance entry since 2016 has reportedly managed to reach 7 million units.

23 Assassin's Creed Brotherhood

Estimated Sales: 8 Million Units

Assassin's Creed Brotherhood
Action
Stealth
Systems
Released
November 16, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature - Blood, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Assassin's Creed Brotherhood stands somewhere between a standalone expansion and a full-fledged entry in the Assassin's Creed series, building upon the immense popularity of its predecessor. For many, the Ezio trilogy represents the peak of the series, with Brotherhood often considered the best of the three, and its sales were appropriately high.

In May 2011, Ubisoft officially announced that Assassin's Creed Brotherhood had sold 7.2 million copies, cementing the series as the company's true rising star in gaming. It's safe to assume that Brotherhood's total sales today have exceeded 8 million units — or possibly even more, thanks to constant discounts for players who missed the original release but wanted to see what all the buzz was about.

22 Assassin's Creed Revelations

Estimated Sales: 8 Million Units

Assassin's Creed Revelations
7 /10
8.6 /10
Released
November 15, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Mild Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

The final installment in the Ezio trilogy, wrapping up the iconic character's story in a mostly satisfying way, Revelations isn't as universally beloved as Assassin's Creed 2 or Brotherhood , showing that players had slowly grown tired of the established formula with few innovations. Despite a less flawless reception among critics and players, Assassin's Creed Revelations was still a massive success, with pre-orders significantly higher than Brotherhood's figures, according to Ubisoft.

In February 2012, just four months after launch, Ubisoft revealed that Assassin's Creed Revelations had sold nearly 7 million copies, ending Ezio's story on a high note and showing overall comparable, if slightly higher, figures than Brotherhood managed in the same timeframe. It's safe to assume that the game continued to add to its sales, presumably exceeding 8 million by 2013.

21 Assassin's Creed (2007)

Estimated Sales: 9 to 10 Million Units

Assassin's Creed
7.7 /10
Released
November 14, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
5 Images
Powered by

The original Assassin's Creed might not be the series' best seller, but over the years, it has amassed impressive sales numbers. Initially launched on Xbox 360 and PS3, the game later arrived on PC, drawing interest from fans of the franchise's later entries who wanted to revisit the title that started it all. While not as iconic as its Ezio-led sequels, Assassin's Creed stands out for its unique setting, atmospheric world, and intricate story.

According to available data, Assassin's Creed 's total sales are estimated to be behind its acclaimed sequels, but not by much. By 2010, the game had sold 8 million copies, so it's reasonable to assume that over the years, it has surpassed 9 million, with some optimistic estimates suggesting it may have even exceeded 10 million. Either way, the original title remains one of the stronger-selling entries in the long-running franchise.

20 For Honor

Estimated Sales: Over 10 Million Units

For Honor
6.8 /10
Released
February 14, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence
Powered by

The combat in For Honor was the biggest draw of the game, and the fact that players could duel online by experimenting with this combat system certainly helped. The initial reception to this game was fairly muted, but this impression became more and more positive over time. According to the latest official intel, the game has attracted over 35 million players since launch, potentially indicating around 10 million copies sold.

A difficult and original combat system is hard to pull off, but Ubisoft has managed to take major steps in this department. Instead of developing a sequel, the company decided to focus on long-term For Honor support, resulting in new content updates being released for the game to this day, more than eight years after launch.

19 Assassin's Creed Unity

Estimated Sales: 10 to 11 Million Units

Assassin's Creed Unity
6 /10
8.2 /10
Released
November 11, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

After its time in the spotlight, people started getting tired of the yearly Assassin's Creed releases. The games simply didn't have that draw anymore, and the popularity of the franchise was hit even harder with the buggy launch of Assassin's Creed Unity .

However, over time, the reception towards Assassin's Creed Unity has certainly eased up a bit, especially since Ubisoft has worked hard to quickly patch up all the title's technical issues. Players have finally started appreciating the strong points of this title, leading to a rise in sales and helping it become one of the best-selling Assassin's Creed games of all time.

18 Watch Dogs 2

Estimated Sales: 10 to 11 Million Units

Watch Dogs 2
8 /10
8.7 /10
Released
November 15, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Following the success of the first game, Ubisoft's executives decided to create a franchise like its other games. Pre-orders for Watch Dogs 2 were low, which led Ubisoft to reduce sales projections for the game, although its CEO was still confident in the game and believed it would be a financial success.

The sales of the game were rather slow at first, but eventually ended up being pretty similar to that of the original game, as was its critical reception. To this day, the cumulative sales numbers are believed to be somewhere near the 10-11 million mark. All that led to the third entry in the series, called Watch Dogs: Legion .

17 Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands

Estimated Sales: 10 to 11 Million Units

Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands
8 /10
7.7 /10
Released
March 7, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands was released in 2017 as the tenth installment in Tom Clancy's franchise, and as the first game in the series to feature an open-world environment. The game's beta version attracted more than six million players, which was, at the time, an indication of the good commercial performance of the game.

When released, the game was one of the biggest launches in the year of its publishing. It became the second fastest-selling game in the series, while simultaneously being the best-selling game in the United Kingdom and the United States in the month of its release.

16 Watch Dogs

Estimated Sales: 10 to 11 Million Units

Watch Dogs
8 /10
8.5 /10
Released
May 26, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature // Blood, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

The indications for the strong commercial performance of Watch Dogs came before the game was even released. It was the most pre-ordered new intellectual property and the most pre-ordered game for the eighth generation of consoles. This culminated in the game being the most pre-ordered game of the year with 800,000 copies.

Initially, the company's executives expected the game to sell more than a million copies. The expectations were met, and after the first week, four million copies of the game were sold. In a report later handed to the public, Ubisoft confirmed that the game had sold more than 9 million copies as of 2014, so we can safely assume that this number has increased over the past years.
